name: Tech Titans
title: Leading in High-Tech Manufacturing
description: In 2022, Myanmar's medium and high-tech manufacturing accounted for 92.58% of its manufacturing value added, showcasing its strong position in the high-tech sector.

name: Short School Days
title: Limited Compulsory Education Duration
description: As of 2023, Myanmar mandates only 5 years of compulsory education, indicating a potential area for educational development.

name: Female Faculty Power
title: High Female Representation in Tertiary Education
description: In 2018, 84.53% of academic staff in Myanmar's tertiary education were female, highlighting gender inclusivity in higher education.

name: Healthy Start
title: Low Prevalence of Overweight in Young Children
description: With only 0.6% of children under 5 being overweight in 2024, Myanmar maintains a healthy start for its youngest citizens.

name: Governance Gaps
title: Challenges in Property Rights and Governance
description: In 2023, Myanmar scored 1 out of 6 in property rights and rule-based governance, indicating significant room for improvement.

name: Trade Troubles
title: Low Trade Rating
description: Myanmar's trade rating was 1.5 out of 6 in 2023, suggesting challenges in trade policies and practices.

name: Human Resource Hurdles
title: Building Human Resources Needs Attention
description: With a rating of 1.5 out of 6 in 2023, Myanmar faces challenges in developing its human resources effectively.

name: Livestock Lows
title: Low Livestock Production Index
description: In 2022, Myanmar's livestock production index was 35.52, indicating a need for growth in this agricultural sector.

name: Manufacturing Mix
title: Minimal Machinery and Transport Equipment Manufacturing
description: In 2020, only 0.59% of Myanmar's manufacturing value added came from machinery and transport equipment, highlighting a narrow manufacturing base.

name: Food Focus
title: Significant Contribution of Food and Beverages in Manufacturing
description: In 2020, food, beverages, and tobacco made up 29.34% of Myanmar's manufacturing value added, emphasizing the sector's importance.
